result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Serve 160 DAYS 
- Credit of 160 days time served. 
- THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by 9/09/22 and pay the surcharge by 9/08/23.  
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 9/08/23. 
- Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Sommerfelt

defendant.name: Sommerfelt, Melissa Marie
defendant.address: 4389 South Pennsylvania Avenue, St. Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in court via video.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Melissa Marie Sommerfelt.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court finds victim notification has been complied with.
Defendant ordered to serve 160 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 160 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by 9/09/22 and pay the surcharge by 9/08/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 9/08/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of her right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance is wavied. Hearing held via zoom. Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Defendant has been revoked and Atty. Romensko requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt not in court, in custody.  
Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Romenesko has discovery and would like time to review it and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melissa Marie Sommerfelt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
